title: Integral pull=out child's seat for vehicles
abstract: The backrest (2) of the vehicle seat has a through opening (11) which is released by the swivelled out seat surface (4) of the child seat (3). The opening can be covered by a flap (14) attached to the vehicle seat backrest and designed to swivel out towards the back. The seat surface (4) and backrest (5) of the child seat (3) lie flat against each other in the backrest face (6) of the vehicle seat backrest (2). The child seat backrest can be locked at different angles to the its seat.

motivations: There is a need for a convenient and integrated child seat solution in vehicles that can be easily deployed and stowed away.
objectives: Design an integral pull-out child's seat for vehicles that can be seamlessly integrated into the vehicle seat backrest.
methods: Create a through opening in the vehicle seat backrest that can be released by the swivelled out seat surface of the child seat.
Use a flap attached to the vehicle seat backrest to cover the opening when the child seat is not in use.
results: Provide a compact and convenient child seat solution that can be easily deployed and stowed away in vehicles.
llama_json.research_subject: Integral pull-out child's seat design for vehicles

motivations: There is a need for a more integrated and convenient child seat solution in vehicles.
objectives: Design a child's seat that can be integrated into the backrest of a vehicle seat.
methods: Incorporate a through opening in the backrest of the vehicle seat that can be released by the swivelled out seat surface of the child seat.
Design a flap attached to the vehicle seat backrest to cover the opening when not in use.
Enable the child seat backrest to be locked at different angles to its seat.
results: Provide a child's seat that can be conveniently integrated into the vehicle seat, improving convenience and space utilization.
openai_json.research_subject: Design of an integrated child's seat for vehicles

motivations: Traditional child seats for vehicles require separate installation and storage, creating inconvenience and safety concerns for parents.
There is a need for space-efficient child seating solutions that are integrated into the vehicle's existing seat structure.
objectives: Design an integrated child seat that can be pulled out from within the vehicle's standard seat backrest.
Create a child seat system that can be easily deployed and stored without requiring additional space or separate components.
methods: Incorporate a through opening in the vehicle seat backrest that houses a foldable child seat with swiveling components.
Design a flap mechanism to cover the opening when the child seat is not in use.
Implement an adjustable locking system for the child seat backrest to accommodate different seating angles.
results: Provides a convenient, space-saving solution for child seating that eliminates the need for separate child seat installation.
Enhances vehicle interior flexibility by allowing seamless transition between adult and child seating configurations.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Integrated pull-out child seat design for vehicles
